subject: Travel
title: How the Silk Road Ended
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How the Silk Road Ended.

hook.text: The Silk Road didn't collapse in a day. It faded slowly as sea routes became faster and cheaper.

buildup.text: Portuguese sailors rounded Africa in 1498, connecting Europe to Asia without middlemen.

discovery.text: Ottoman taxes and Mongol Empire collapse made overland routes dangerous and expensive again.

twist.text: The final blow was the steamship. What took caravans a year, ships did in weeks.

climax.text: By the 1700s, the great oasis cities were ghost towns. The desert reclaimed the trade posts.

punchline.text: The ocean made the desert road obsolete.

quiz.question: What mainly caused the decline of the Silk Road?
